document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Alkindus Distant (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Thyreocoridae: Corimelaeninae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the genus Alkindus Distant (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Thyreocoridae: Corimelaeninae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Departamento de Zoologia, Programa de Pós-Graduação em Biologia Animal, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, Av. Bento Gonçalves, 9500, Bloco IV, Prédio 43435, 91501 - 970, Porto Alegre, RS, Brazil

Departamento de Zoologia, Programa de Pós-Graduação em Biologia Animal, Universidade Federal do Rio Grande do Sul, Av. Bento Gonçalves, 9500, Bloco IV, Prédio 43435, 91501 - 970, Porto Alegre, RS, Brazil

subSubSection.paragraph:
Alkindus atratus Distant, 1889 : 309
; Lethierry & Severin 1893 : 14 (catalogue); McAtee & Malloch 1933 : 348–349 (redescription); Becker & Grazia-Vieira 1971 : 9 (distribution records); Maes 1994 : 21 (catalogue).
Pronotum. Broad lateral punctate area. Callus slightly rastrate.

Abdominal venter ( Figs. 9 , 13 ). Sternite VII on average 0.6 and 1.2 times the length of segments III–VI in female and male, respectively; anterior margin of sternite VII broadly rounded in female and narrowly rounded to sub angulate in male, posterior margin rounded in both sexes. Lateral bristles present on all visible abdominal segments (including laterotergites 8 and 9 in female), these longer and thicker than the trichobothria, located laterally and in line with anterior trichobothria.

Type material
(examined).
Holotype ♂ and
paratype ♀ . Tolé, Panama , Champion ; Tierra Colorado , Guerrero ,
2.000 ft .
, October , H. H. Smith ( BMNH ).
